statements.original: There are more countries in South America than Africa.

explanation: there are 54 countries in Africa compared to 12 in South America.

statements.original: Taste buds can only be found on the tongue.

explanation: while most taste buds are on your tongue, there are also taste cells in the back of your throat, on your epiglottis, your nose and sinuses, throat and upper part of the esophagus.

statements.original: An astronaut has played golf on the moon.

explanation: Alan Shepard took time out of his space duties to hit the links, noting one of his shots "went for miles and miles."

statements.original: Toy Story was Pixar's first movie.

explanation: it was released in 1995. To date, three more Toy Story films have been released.

statements.original: Humans lose more than 80% of heat from their feet.

explanation: 80% of heat is lost through the head.

statements.original: Punxsutawney Phil is just a nickname for the famous groundhog.

explanation: the groundhog's full name is Punxsutawney Phil, Seer of Seers, Sage of Sages, Prognosticator of Prognosticators, and Weather Prophet Extraordinary.

statements.original: Pizza was the first food consumed in space.

explanation: the astronauts first ate up applesauce.

statements.original: An octopus has seven hearts.

explanation: it has three hearts and they do a lot of work. One heart circulates blood around the body and the other two pump blood past the gills and pick up oxygen.

statements.original: John Glenn became the oldest astronaut when he traveled to space at the age of 53.

explanation: John Glenn was actually 77 years old.

statements.original: Santa Claus has his own postal code.

explanation: in Canada the Postal Service has designated H0H 0H0 (ho ho ho) as the official postcode for letters to Santa. Volunteers have been helping Santa reply to the letters for over 30 years.

statements.original: People who have chiclephobia are afraid of cats.

explanation: people who suffer from chiclephobia have a fear of chewing gum or being around a person chewing gum.

statements.original: Most of the human brain is made of muscle.

explanation: 60% is made up of fat, making it the fattiest organ.

statements.original: The total length of the Great Wall of China adds up to 13,171 miles.

explanation: that distance is half the length of the equator.

statements.original: Soccer (football) is estimated to have more than 2 billion fans around the world.

explanation: Soccer is the world's most popular sport with an estimated 4 billion fans worldwide. More than half the world's population tunes in to watch the World Cup every four years.

statements.original: An ant can lift 1,000 times its body weight.

explanation: ants can lift 5,000 times their body weight!

statements.original: Every country in the world has a rectangular flag.

explanation: Nepal's flag resembles two pennants stitched together.

statements.original: The tradition of dyeing Easter eggs started in the United States.

explanation: egg dyeing originated in ancient Ukraine. Painted eggs were believed to bring fertility and good harvests.

statements.original: The Chinese New Year is celebrated on the same day every year.

explanation: the festival falls between January 21 and February 20 and is determined by the Chinese lunar calendar.

statements.original: Minnie Mouse's full name is Wilhelmina Mouse.

explanation: her real name is Minerva Mouse.

statements.original: It took eight months from start to finish to produce the 1959 Disney film, Sleeping Beauty.

explanation: it took eight years.
